A 2003 U.S. State Department report on Equatorial Guinea stated that "although the 2002 (sic) census estimated the population at 1.015.000  credible estimates put the number at closer to 500.000. The opposition claimed that the Government inflated the census in anticipation of the December presidential election. (...)
